answer.text_box: I try to minimize my use of AI. My work also does not need AI at all.

displayed_text:
Below is a summary of people's opinions on the issue.

Overall summary of comments:

  • Overall sentiment: Most commenters describe positive changes from AI in their daily lives (roughly 70–75%), while about 20–30% express mixed or cautious views. A small minority (under 10%) report negative stances or active avoidance.

  • Most common benefits:

  • Productivity and time savings at work, school, and home (speeding up routine tasks, reducing effort, freeing time).
  • Easier research and information access, including summaries and technical explanations, often described as “like how search used to be.”
  • Writing support (drafting, editing, formatting, correcting dictation, learning new words) and help with emails, resumes, letters, and proposals.
  • Creativity and ideation (brainstorming, art assistance, photo editing), event planning, making tables, and generating project ideas (e.g., remodeling, passive income).

  • Personal uses such as homework help, tutoring, personalized recommendations, home automation, and even guidance for interpersonal reflection. Some also note entertainment value.

  • Common concerns and drawbacks:

  • Privacy and data tracking: worries about how much personal information AI collects and retains.
  • Accuracy, bias, and reliability: need to fact-check summaries and sources; concerns about source selection.
  • Trust and ethics in creative fields: vigilance toward AI-generated art/writing; some view AI as theft and try to avoid it.
  • Employment impacts: anxiety about potential job loss.
  • Algorithmic effects: feeling more drawn into social media due to AI-driven feeds.

  • A few say AI is helpful but hasn’t substantially changed their lives; they treat it as an optional tool.

  • Net takeaway: AI is widely seen as a practical assistant that boosts efficiency, learning, and creativity, but it also heightens concerns about privacy, trust, and ethical use—prompting many to verify outputs and set personal boundaries around when and how they use it.

Two summaries of opinions are shown below. Read carefully and answer according to your prior opinion. Both are scrollable.

Summary A

Overall summary of comments:

  • Overall sentiment: Most commenters describe positive changes from AI in their daily lives (roughly 70–75%), while about 20–30% express mixed or cautious views. A small minority (under 10%) report negative stances or active avoidance.

  • Most common benefits:

  • Productivity and time savings at work, school, and home (speeding up routine tasks, reducing effort, freeing time).
  • Easier research and information access, including summaries and technical explanations, often described as “like how search used to be.”
  • Writing support (drafting, editing, formatting, correcting dictation, learning new words) and help with emails, resumes, letters, and proposals.
  • Creativity and ideation (brainstorming, art assistance, photo editing), event planning, making tables, and generating project ideas (e.g., remodeling, passive income).

  • Personal uses such as homework help, tutoring, personalized recommendations, home automation, and even guidance for interpersonal reflection. Some also note entertainment value.

  • Common concerns and drawbacks:

  • Privacy and data tracking: worries about how much personal information AI collects and retains.
  • Accuracy, bias, and reliability: need to fact-check summaries and sources; concerns about source selection.
  • Trust and ethics in creative fields: vigilance toward AI-generated art/writing; some view AI as theft and try to avoid it.
  • Employment impacts: anxiety about potential job loss.
  • Algorithmic effects: feeling more drawn into social media due to AI-driven feeds.

  • A few say AI is helpful but hasn’t substantially changed their lives; they treat it as an optional tool.

  • Net takeaway: AI is widely seen as a practical assistant that boosts efficiency, learning, and creativity, but it also heightens concerns about privacy, trust, and ethical use—prompting many to verify outputs and set personal boundaries around when and how they use it.

Summary B

Overall, the comments reveal a highly nuanced and multifaceted relationship with AI. A significant majority express that AI has positively transformed their lives by dramatically improving efficiency and productivity. Many report that it saves time by automating routine tasks, accelerates research, and streamlines work processes, leading to a common sentiment of having more free time.

AI is widely valued as a powerful tool for information retrieval, with many highlighting its ability to provide quick summaries and compile data far more effectively than traditional search engines. It is also frequently praised for its role in enhancing creativity, offering assistance with writing, art generation, and brainstorming new ideas. For some, it functions as a tutor, helping them learn new skills and understand complex topics.

However, these positive impacts are tempered by a strong undercurrent of concern. A notable portion of comments express significant anxiety about privacy, citing unease over data collection and how personal information is used. Job security is another major worry, with many fearing that AI could make their roles obsolete. There is also widespread distrust in the information AI provides, with many users noting a critical need to fact-check outputs for accuracy and bias. Furthermore, some feel that the proliferation of AI, particularly in creative fields and on social media, has led to a loss of authenticity, originality, and human connection. A small minority report that their lives remain largely unchanged by AI, viewing it as just another tool or a source of entertainment.
